lead_paragraph: More than three months after Raheel Siddiqui fell to his death at a training depot, 15 drill instructors and other Marine leaders are under investigation.

byline.contributor: Amy Haimerl reported from Taylor, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.
byline.original: By AMY HAIMERL and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

headline.print_headline: Recruit’s Death Leads to Wider Investigation of Assaults and Hazing in the Marines
headline.main: Recruit’s Death Leads to Wider Investigation of Abuse in Marines

snippet: More than three months after Raheel Siddiqui fell to his death at a training depot, 15 drill instructors and other Marine leaders are under investigation....
abstract: Fifteen drill instructors and other leaders of United States Marine Corps are under investigation for allegations that hazing incident in Parris Island, SC, training camp may have led to March death of recruit Raheel Siddiqui; witness has called Siddiqui's fatal fall from third floor barracks suicide but family has disputed account.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
